Cameras¶

Cameras are an integral part of spyral’s display operations. They handle the advanced features including layering and scaling. To get the default camera, call spyral.director.get_camera().

class spyral.camera.Camera(virtual_size=None, real_size=None, offset=(0, 0), layers=['all'], root=False)[source]¶

Represents an area to draw to. It can handle automatic scaling with optional offsets, layering, and more soon.

draw()[source]¶

Draws the current frame. Should be called only once per frame by the current Scene.

get_rect()[source]¶

Returns a rect the virtual size of this camera’s display

get_size()[source]¶

Returns the virtual size of this camera’s display.

layers()[source]¶

Returns a list of this camera’s layers.

make_child(virtual_size=None, real_size=None, offset=(0, 0), layers=['all'])[source]¶

Method for creating a new Camera.

virtual_size is a size of the virtual resolution to be used.
real_size is a size of the resolution with respect to the parent camera (not to the physical display, unless the parent camera is the root one). This allows multi-level nesting of cameras, if needed.
offset is a position offset of where this camera should be in the parent camera’s coordinates.
layers is a list of layers which should be drawn bottom to top.
set_background(surface)[source]¶

Sets a background for this camera’s display.

world_to_local(pos)[source]¶

Converts coordinates from the display to coordinates in this camera’s space. If the coordinate is outside, then it returns None.
